summary: The conversation is about critical race theory and its role in the education system. The speaker discusses how politicians, specifically right-wing politicians, have created a negative perception of critical race theory and have passed laws prohibiting its teaching. The speaker argues that this is a violation of freedom of speech and education. They explain that critical race theory is a community of ideas that originated in legal academia with scholars like Derek Bell and Kimberly Crenshaw. The speaker agrees that racism is deeply embedded in American life but disagrees with the proposition that America is doomed to always be governed by white supremacy. They also criticize certain aspects of critical race theory, particularly its views on freedom of speech and the expungement of racist beliefs. The speaker believes that critical race theory should remain a part of the intellectual universe and that people should be able to debate and form their own conclusions about its strengths and weaknesses.
